title: Peter Sarsgaard isn't in Twin Peaks after all, even though he would love to be - Twin Peaks Cult -
text: Peter Sarsgaard has said that despite reports to the contrary, he isn't going to be in the Twin Peaks revival after all.The Killing actor was reported to have joined the third season in a recurring role, but he has now distanced himself from the project.Twin Peaks returns: Everything you need to know about season 3, from the cast to the plot"I'm not doing Twin Peaks," he told EW Morning Live."But it certainly was a rumour that was not founded on nothing."He added: "I would love to be in Twin Peaks. I watched them all, I think twice."Though we're now not sure what to believe, Amanda Seyfried, Balthazar Getty and Prison Break's Robert Knepper are reportedly new additions to David Lynch and Mark Frost's series.The only confirmed member of the cast is Kyle MacLachlan, who returns as Special Agent Dale Cooper to lead the show.Frost and Lynch have promised that other classic characters will feature, though Michael Ontkean is said to not be returning as Harry S Truman.The Log Lady actress Catherine E Coulson had said she would appear in the new season, but it is not clear if she filmed any scenes before her death last month at the age of 71.
